metadata.title: CVE-2018-20856 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 4.18.7. Inblock/blk-core.c, there is an __blk_drain_queue() use-after-free because acertain error case is mishandled.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20856` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-161-generic - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-lowlatency - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-4.4.0-161-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-161-generic - 4.4.0-161.189
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-161-lowlatency - 4.4.0-161.189
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1120-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1120.129
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1124-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1124.130
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1092-aws - 4.4.0-1092.103
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-generic - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-58-lowlatency - 4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1055-azure - 4.15.0-1055.60
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1040-gcp - 4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1056-kvm - 4.4.0-1056.63
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1021-oracle - 4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1019-fips - 4.4.0-1019.24

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-161.189').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
